content.raw:
> Wouldn't it be better to go ahead and specify some default values for other properties too?

The other properties will use the default values from the ign::common::Pbr class:

[#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/src/9bb7e81da6065268c5aec947d94ee6c3c673cad9/graphics/src/Pbr.cc#lines-24](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/src/9bb7e81da6065268c5aec947d94ee6c3c673cad9/graphics/src/Pbr.cc#lines-24)

> But they will affect `ogre2` users not using PBR, right? Do you think it's worth the risk of introducing this into Blueprint / Citadel at this point?

It’ll affect ogre2 users using dae / obj files without specifying PBR `<material>` . I thought about putting this change in ign-common4 / Dome but went with the idea of introducing this change early when there are fewer ignition users. One main reason behind this is that since Ignition citadel is a LTS, people may stick to this version until the next ignition LTS. By then, there could be several more assets created and tuned for current metalness value.
